intro: Alstroemeria rosea, commonly known as the Peruvian lily, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features strap-like leaves that are dark green in color. Its flowers come in a range of colors, including red, pink, orange, and yellow, making it a popular ornamental plant. Alstroemeria rosea prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, thriving in temperate climates.
